review_title: Love being an RN at Centracare
job_title: RN Staff Nurse in Saint Cloud, MN
pros: Professionalism from coworkers, has a float pool, you can make your own schedule, lots of education and training available, has an IV team, it is Magnet certified,
cons: a long commute for me, but is not a deal breaker

review_title: CentraCare is a decent company despite being a monopoly in the area
job_title: Health Unit Coordinator (HUC) in Saint Cloud, MN
pros: The schedule allowed for stretches of several days off due to working 12 hour shifts. The work atmosphere was generally good. Occasionally you had good charge nurses on the units that were flexible about phone use and talking with coworkers while on shift. Senior management seems to care about the employees.
cons: Pay rate wasn't great and they don't take education/experience into consideration when calculating pay. I had a 4 year degree and my co-worker who had less medical field experience and a HS education was making $2/hr more than I was. Some charge nurses on the units would power trip and get after you for talking with your coworkers about non-work related things even during downtimes on the floor. The mood of the unit would very heavily be influenced by which charge nurse was on duty.

job_title: Registered Nurse, BSN in Saint Cloud, MN
pros:
Good teamwork among nurses 
Lots of resources, IV team, resource nurse, good nurse to patient ratios

job_title: Registered Nurse in Saint Cloud, MN
cons: low pay. cannot get full raise. other departments get full raise but ICU cannot until trained in every competency which takes approximately 5 years

pros: People you work with are great.
cons: The administration just cares about the dollars and treats the employees like a number.

job_title: Health Unit Coordinator in Saint Cloud, MN
pros: Part time hours worked easily into my schedule. Had the option to work 8 or 12 hour shifts. Nursing supervisor was very supportive.
cons: I didn’t care for the uniform, I would have preferred to wear scrubs or business wear.

job_title: Nursing Assistant in Saint Cloud, MN
cons: It was better to work there before covid

job_title: Charge Nurse in Saint Cloud, MN
pros: Trusted company , great opportunity for advancement

job_title: Registered Nurse in Saint Cloud, MN
pros: Treats staff well and ask for staff input frequently
cons: Not union. Twin cities hospitals pays more

job_title: Patient Care Assistant (PCA) in Saint Cloud, MN
cons: They may have rigid schedules sometime

job_title: Catering Associate in Saint Cloud, MN
pros: have the ability to always pick up hours
cons: Low wage, extremely short staffed, terrible communication, no accountability for wrongdoing, and no incentive for going above and beyond.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Saint Cloud, MN
pros:
- Great pay
- Is a welcoming teaching hospital. Physicians, nurses, and other staff are usually more than willing to educate/show you new things if are a pleasant, eager learner
- Many different units
-  Interesting committees that truly make a difference 
- I absolutely love my job as a nursing assistant
cons:
- Some tension between white and Somali workers (St. Cloud itself has quite a lot of bigotry and is toxic at times)
- Little education on how to best provide healthcare to a multicultural community
- Staff is frustrated with CEO raises, budget cuts, and company spending 
- iPads were bought on every unit to be available to patients, as well as specialized UV machines to clean them. The iPads are rarely used and are a nuisance to explain how they work to elderly patients. Each room has a TV and most patients bring in their own technology to use instead of the hospital's iPads. I've only used our UV sanitation machines to clean the hospital's phones that staff use to communicate throughout their shifts.

review_title: Loved my first four years there, hated the rest.
